Title.evidence: Background: Bladder cancer is one of the most prevalent malignancies within the urinary system, with incidence and mortality rates showing a global upward trend.

Participants.evidence: Data from bladder cancer patients diagnosed between 2011 and 2015 were extracted using SEER*Stat software.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to examine the clinical characteristics of bladder cancer patients with a history of prior malignancies and to develop a prognostic model using extensive data from the Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results (SEER) database to inform clinical treatment strategies.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 12,260 bladder cancer patients were analyzed, including 8,959 individuals with no prior tumor history and 3,301 individuals with a history of previous tumors.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean survival duration for patients with a prior tumor history was 56.04±39.96 months, significantly lower than the 70.28±39.36 months for patients without a prior tumor history (P<0.001).
